page.title: 13Bwlch-y-groes in 1955 (1)
page.content: Most people walked to work.Farmers had cars.Some workers had motor bikes.People walked to Boncath to catch the train to Cardigan.Food was plain.Vegetables were homegrown,butter and cheese from the cows and home-baked bread.Nearly everyone kept a pig and a cow.Children made up their own games or played cards,dominoes and draughts.House games were few.There were only 5 or 6 large families,but more people lived in the district. People worked long hours.In their spare time they went to the youth club,concerts or Eisteddfodau.Few went on holiday.The roads were poor.There was no tar on the minor roads.Council workers looked after 3 miles of roads and hedges.The shops sold everything from nails to shoes.People only had a radio.Welsh programmes were few.There were 2 batteries,1 wet and 1 dry.
